# Southwest Airlines (LUV) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Southwest Airlines Co. operates as a passenger airline company that provides scheduled air transportation services in the United States and near-international markets. As of December 31, 2024, the company operated a total fleet of 803 Boeing 737 aircraft; and served 117 destinations in 42 states, the District of Columbia, and the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, as well as ten near-international countries, including Mexico, Jamaica, the Bahamas, Aruba, the Dominican Republic, Costa Rica, Belize, Cuba, the Cayman Islands, and Turks and Caicos. Southwest Airlines Co. was incorporated in 1967 and is headquartered in Dallas, Texas.

Southwest took flight in 1971 to democratize the sky through friendly, reliable, and low-cost air travel and now carries more air travelers flying nonstop within the United States than any other airline. By empowering its more than 72,000 People to deliver unparalleled Hospitality, the maverick airline cherishes a passionate loyalty among more than 140 million Customers carried in 2024.

It is the third-largest airline in North America when measured by passengers carried, as of 2024. The airline operates under a unique point-to-point network model rather than the traditional hub-and-spoke system, providing direct flights between city pairs while maintaining operational simplicity through its all-Boeing 737 fleet strategy.

## 2. Current Market Data

**Stock Price & Market Cap:**
- Current stock price: approximately $42.47 (as of January 2025)
- Market capitalization: $21.92 billion USD (as of December 2025), making Southwest Airlines the world's 1036th most valuable company by market cap

**Stock Performance:**
- Shares of Southwest are up nearly 24% in 2025, more than any other U.S. passenger carrier
- Industry profit leaders Delta Air Lines and United Airlines have risen about 17% each this year

**Financial Metrics:**
- TTM Revenue: $27.551B; EPS (TTM): 0.67; P/E (TTM): 63.38; Forward P/E: 14.44
- Fourth quarter and full year 2024 net income of $261 million and $465 million, or $0.42 and $0.76 per diluted share, respectively. In 2024, Southwest Airlines Co.'s revenue was $27.48 billion, an increase of 5.34% compared to the previous year's $26.09 billion

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Core Services:**
- Inflight entertainment and connectivity services; Rapid Rewards loyalty program that enables program members to earn points for dollars spent on Southwest base fares. The company offers a suite of digital platforms to support customers' travel needs, including websites and apps; and SWABIZ, an online booking tool. It provides ancillary services, such as Southwest's EarlyBird Check-In, upgraded boarding, and transportation of pets and unaccompanied minors

**Fleet & Network:**
- As of March 2025, Southwest Airlines operates an all-Boeing fleet of 800 Boeing 737 aircraft, making it one of the largest commercial airlines in the world. The airline has built a distinctive reputation with its single-aircraft strategy
- Southwest Airlines is the world's most prolific MAX operator. The carrier is projected to operate an astonishing 445,505 flights using the 737 MAX family, overwhelmingly more than any other airline

**Fleet Composition:**
- Boeing 737-700: Southwest operates 346 Boeing 737-700 aircraft, the largest fleet of this variant in the world. These aircraft have a seating capacity of 143 passengers
- Boeing 737-800: The airline operates 204 Boeing 737-800 aircraft, with a seating capacity of 175 passengers
- Boeing 737 MAX 8: Southwest operates 250 Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft, the largest operator of this variant worldwide

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Assigned Seating Transformation:**
- We're transitioning from open to assigned seating, starting with flights on or after January 27, 2026. With most fares, Customers will be able to choose their seat at booking. We are also moving from our current A/B/C groups with numbered positions to a new boarding structure using Groups 1 through 8
- Southwest in October forecast that assigned seating and extra legroom seats could drive $1 billion in pretax earnings next year and $1.5 billion in pretax earnings in 2027

**New Fare Structure:**
- We'll continue to offer four fare bundle options, now with updated names and new benefits. Basic launched on May 28, 2025. The remaining new fare products are launching today, aligning with the introduction of assigned and premium seating. Customers can now book flights with assigned seats for travel beginning on January 27, 2026

**Premium Seating & Cabin Updates:**
- On May 1, 2025, Southwest introduced the first aircraft with new extra-legroom seating as part of a phased update to its cabin layout. These seats will be installed in the first five rows and near exit doors on retrofitted Boeing 737-800 and MAX 8 aircraft. During the initial rollout, the seats will be available at no additional cost as the airline continues to operate under an open seating policy

**Fleet Expansion:**
- Southwest is yet to take delivery of its 737 MAX 7 aircraft, but it has placed an order for 342 units, set to begin entering service in 2026. The MAX 7 will replace the aging 737-700 in Southwest's fleet
- Additionally, as of November 2025, Southwest has over 500 Boeing 737 MAX aircraft on order

**Potential First Class:**
- Bob Jordan, Chief Executive Officer of Southwest Airlines, has confirmed that the carrier is seriously considering First Class seating. He has framed the move as a response to industry-wide "premiumization" trends. First Class seating could become a defining feature of Southwest's product as early as 2026

## 5. Growth Strategy

**"Southwest. Even Better." Transformation Plan:**
- "As we look forward, 2025 will be a pivotal year as we continue to execute and deliver on our 'Southwest. Even Better.' transformational plan, the largest and most comprehensive in our 53-year history"
- "We have already realized approximately one-third of our $1.8 billion 2025 initiative EBIT target in the first half of 2025 and remain highly confident in our ability to realize the remaining amount during the second half of the year"

**Revenue Diversification:**
- "These initiatives are coming online quickly, and we are pleased with performance thus far, including bag fee revenue exceeding expectations. We are encouraged by the incremental fare product buy-up that is already occurring at this early stage and in advance of assigned and premium seating that we will begin selling next week for flights beginning January 2026"

**Cost Management:**
- Similarly, we are working to accelerate and exceed our 2027 $500 million cost reduction target, supporting a 2025 CASM-X exit rate in the low-single digits

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Customer Base:**
- The maverick airline cherishes a passionate loyalty among more than 140 million Customers carried in 2024
- Southwest remains mass-market rather than premium, foregoing business/first cabins and global alliance breadth in favor of simplicity, lower distribution friction, and leisure-heavy demand capture

**Market Segments:**
- Primary focus on leisure travelers and cost-conscious business travelers
- Its low-cost model and two-free checked bags policy have attracted leisure and business travelers alike
- Strong presence in secondary airports and point-to-point routes serving mid-size cities

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**2024 Financial Results:**
- Fourth quarter and full year net income of $261 million and $465 million, or $0.42 and $0.76 per diluted share, respectively
- Fourth quarter 2024 operating revenues were a fourth quarter record $6.9 billion, a 1.6 percent increase, year-over-year
- In 2024, Southwest Airlines Co.'s revenue was $27.48 billion, an increase of 5.34% compared to the previous year's $26.09 billion

**Capital Allocation:**
- Based on confidence in our performance and outlook, we are launching a $750 million accelerated share repurchase, with the initial $250 million share repurchase now complete
- The Company announced its 185th quarterly dividend on May 13, 2025

**2025 Guidance:**
- More recently, the government shutdown that ended last month hurt demand prompting Southwest to again lower its earnings outlook for the year. Southwest typically provides its yearly outlook alongside the previous year's earnings in late January

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
- While we still have much work to do, we are pleased that the improvements from our tactical initiatives are materializing faster than expected, and our progress continues to be further supported by a constructive demand environment and industry backdrop
- Strong brand recognition and customer loyalty
- Ranked the #1 Airline for Economy Class Customer Satisfaction in the J.D. Power 2024 North America Airline Satisfaction Study for the third consecutive year · Ranked No. 1 on Newsweek's 2024 America's Best Customer Service List in the Airlines and Low-Cost Airlines subcategories

**Headwinds:**
- The single-fleet model of roughly 800+ Boeing 737s supports high utilization and simplified maintenance, but MAX 7 certification delays reduced 2024–2025 deliveries and deferred some fleet renewal plans
- Southwest, like other airlines, cut its profit forecast for 2025 after demand dipped early this year as President Donald Trump's tariffs and cost cutting in Washington weighed on bookings. More recently, the government shutdown that ended last month hurt demand
- Customer resistance to fare structure changes
- One financial newspaper editorial labeled the shift "a money grab," while social media has been filled with criticism. Many loyal customers view the shift as a betrayal of the airline's founding identity and are publicly threatening to switch carriers

## 9. Market Shares

**Domestic Market Position:**
- With a 19% market share, it continues to be a dominant force in domestic travel. Southwest Airlines remains the second-largest airline in the US, offering 19,805,220 seats in March 2025. Southwest Airlines holds roughly 20% of U.S. domestic capacity as of mid‑2025
- This cements its position at the top of the rankings, followed closely by Southwest Airlines (WN) and Delta Air Lines (DL), which maintain 19% and 18% market shares, respectively. With 18.8 million seats for Southwest and 18.6 million for Delta, the competition among the top three carriers remains tight. The dominance of the big four carriers — American Airlines, Southwest Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and United Airlines — continues, with these airlines collectively accounting for 73% of total seat capacity in the United States

**Aircraft Operations:**
- Southwest took flight in 1971 to democratize the sky through friendly, reliable, and low-cost air travel and now carries more air travelers flying nonstop within the United States than any other airline. Southwest is America's largest domestic airline in terms of domestic originating passengers

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**vs. Major Legacy Carriers:**
- American, Delta, and United use global alliances, premium cabins, and corporate contracts to extract higher revenue per seat on long‑haul and business routes, pressuring Southwest on key O&Ds
- Southwest's absence of premium cabins and global alliances constrains RASM upside versus Delta and American

**vs. Ultra Low-Cost Carriers:**
- Spirit and Frontier compress fares and CASM in leisure markets (notably Florida, Vegas, Denver), driving price dispersion that squeezes Southwest's margins on competitive routes
- Southwest Airlines and Delta Air Lines remain close competitors, reflecting the highly competitive nature of the US airline industry. Meanwhile, Allegiant Air's remarkable 22.1% growth underscores the continued expansion of low-cost carriers

**Market Rankings 2025:**
- American Airlines continues to dominate the skies, solidifying its position as the busiest airline in the U.S. by offering approximately 23.2 million one-way seats domestically. Holding about 21% of the market share
- Southwest consistently ranks as the #2 domestic carrier by capacity and passengers carried

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**International Partnership Strategy:**
- Our first international partnership is with Icelandair®. Our interline partnership connects Customers on Icelandair into the Southwest network at Baltimore/Washington (BWI) Airport, Denver (DEN), Nashville (BNA), Orlando (MCO), Pittsburgh (PIT), and Raleigh/Durham (RDU)

**Turkish Airlines Partnership (2026):**
- We're excited to announce our latest partnership with Turkish Airlines. With this agreement, our Passengers will be able to travel to more than 350 destinations in 132 countries from its global hub in Istanbul. As of January 2026, our Passengers can book travel through both Turkish Airlines and third-party booking channels

**Partnership Portfolio:**
- In addition to Turkish, Southwest partner carriers now comprise Condor Airlines, China Airlines, EVA Air, Icelandair, and Philippine Airlines. The Turkish Airlines partnership joins a growing list of international allies Southwest has secured this year, including Icelandair, Condor, China Airlines, EVA Air, and Philippine Airlines

**Strategic Approach:**
- Southwest is still new to the world of airline partnerships, so it's interesting to see the approach the carrier is taking. For example, Icelandair was announced as the first partner, and it seems pretty clear the airlines are actually planning a higher level of cooperation, eventually having a codeshare agreement, frequent flyer reciprocity, etc.

**No Major M&A Activity:**
- No significant merger or acquisition activity reported in recent periods
- Focus remains on organic growth and strategic partnerships rather than consolidation

## 12. Recent Developments

**Elliott Management Settlement (October 2024):**
- Southwest Airlines and activist investor Elliott Investment Management said Thursday they've struck a settlement that averts a proxy fight. The deal includes the appointment of six directors to the airline's board and the earlier retirement of Executive Chairman Gary Kelly. Southwest CEO Bob Jordan will keep his job
- With eight new directors joining as a result of the settlement and of Southwest's earlier board refreshment, the deal is the largest board change Elliott has driven in a U.S. fight

**Austin Crew Base Expansion (December 2025):**
- Southwest Airlines Co. announced today that a new Crew Base for Pilots and Flight Attendants will open in March 2026 in Austin, Texas, creating more than 2,000 new jobs based at Austin Bergstrom International Airport (AUS)
- The new base, located at Austin Bergstrom International Airport, will open in March and initially hold roughly 1,000 employees. By mid-2027, the base will expand to reach its expected size of 2,000 employees, who will be paid an average salary of $180,000

**Baggage Fee Implementation (May 2025):**
- Baggage Fees: Southwest ended "Bags Fly Free" in May 2025. The first checked bag now costs $35, and the second $45, unless traveling on the highest fare tier or as an A-List Preferred member

**Operational Performance:**
- We are also pleased with our continued strong operational performance. The recent recognition we received by the Wall Street Journal's 2024 annual airline rankings is a testament to our outstanding People and the significant investments we have made in our operation

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Rating: 7.2/10**

**Rationale for Rating:**

**Strengths Supporting the Rating:**
1. **Successful Transformation Execution:** The company is successfully implementing its revenue transformation initiatives, with bag fee revenue exceeding expectations and having "already realized approximately one-third of our $1.8 billion 2025 initiative EBIT target in the first half of 2025"

2. **Strong Stock Performance:** Southwest shares are up nearly 24% in 2025, outperforming all other U.S. passenger carriers

3. **Market Leadership Position:** Maintains a solid 19-20% domestic market share and remains the second-largest U.S. airline

4. **Revenue Growth Potential:** Assigned seating and extra legroom initiatives are projected to drive $1 billion in pretax earnings in 2026 and $1.5 billion by 2027

5. **Operational Excellence:** Ranked #1 Airline for Economy Class Customer Satisfaction by J.D. Power for the third consecutive year

**Factors Limiting the Rating:**
1. **Customer Backlash Risk:** Significant customer resistance to fare structure changes, with critics calling it "a money grab" and loyal customers threatening to switch carriers

2. **Fleet Delivery Challenges:** MAX 7 certification delays have reduced 2024-2025 deliveries and deferred fleet renewal plans

3. **External Demand Pressures:** The airline has cut profit forecasts due to demand impacts from government policies and recent shutdown effects

**Fair Value Estimate: $47-50 per share**

**Valuation Methodology:**
- Current trading range: ~$42-43
- Analyst consensus 12-month price target: $38.06
- Average 12-month price target: $37.63 with high estimate of $56 and low of $24

**Fair Value Justification:**
The $47-50 target reflects a premium to current analyst consensus based on:
1. Successful early execution of transformation initiatives generating incremental revenue
2. Strong operational performance and customer satisfaction metrics
3. Potential for significant earnings growth from assigned seating ($1B+ EBIT impact by 2026-2027)
4. Market-leading stock performance indicating investor confidence
5. Strategic expansion opportunities (Austin crew base, international partnerships)

**Risk Considerations:**
- Customer defection due to policy changes could limit upside
- Boeing delivery delays may constrain growth capacity
- Economic headwinds and government policy impacts on travel demand
- Competitive pressure from both legacy carriers and ULCCs

**Investment Recommendation:** 
MODERATE BUY with a growth-oriented, moderate-risk appetite focus. The company's successful transformation execution and strong market position support upside potential, while operational excellence and customer loyalty provide downside protection. The 7.2/10 rating reflects strong fundamentals with manageable execution risks in a transformative period.
tldr_summary:
Southwest Airlines is a major U.S. low-cost carrier operating primarily domestic routes with an all-Boeing 737 fleet, serving 117 destinations and carrying 140 million passengers in 2024. The company is undergoing a significant transformation, shifting from open to assigned seating and introducing new fare structures, with initiatives projected to generate $1-1.5 billion in pretax earnings by 2027. With a 19% domestic market share and strong brand loyalty, Southwest is expanding international partnerships (including Turkish Airlines) and investing in operational improvements. Key strategic moves include introducing baggage fees, potential first-class seating, and fleet modernization with Boeing 737 MAX aircraft. Recent leadership changes following an Elliott Management settlement and continued customer satisfaction leadership position the airline for potential growth.

The AI analysis rates Southwest a MODERATE BUY at 7.2/10, with a fair value estimate of $47-50 per share, reflecting promising transformation strategies and market leadership balanced against potential customer resistance and operational challenges.
